bestBHT.bht: Peter hesitates when faced with a command from God, objecting that he has never eaten anything common or unclean. This objection stems from his strict adherence to the distinction between clean and unclean foods in line with his upbringing. However, the vision signifies more than just dietary laws, representing the end of old distinctions. Despite his doubt, Peter's hesitation reflects his godly and religious approach, desiring to fully understand God's will before acting. Through this moment of uncertainty, the will of God becomes evident and Peter's faith in the new revelation solidifies.

bhtAttempts.bht: Peter, in response to a command from God, hesitantly objects that he has never eaten anything common or unclean. This objection stems from Peter's upbringing, which ingrained in him the strict distinction between clean and unclean foods. However, the vision is more than just about dietary laws, for it is a revelation that the old distinctions and separations are coming to an end. The vision challenges Peter's deeply held beliefs and leads him to question the voice of the Lord. Yet, in his doubt and hesitation, Peter demonstrates a godly and religious attitude: he desires to understand God's will fully before acting. This moment of uncertainty ultimately enables the will of God to be made evident and solidifies Peter's belief in the new revelation.
